name: Curatorial Perspectives I
description: This course is designed to offer students direct encounters with artists and curators through studio and gallery visits. Field encounters, written assignments, readings and research focus on contemporary art and curatorial practices. The course will provide skills in composing critical views, artist statements, and writing proposals for art projects.
prerequisites: [[VPSA62H3 and VPSA63H3] and [0.5 credit at the B-level in VPS courses]] or [enrolment in the Minor in Curatorial Studies]
